editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msItem.rubric: De generacione elementorum Aliter de Naturalibus questionibus
msItem.incipit: Grandinem hoc meo fieri si tibi affirmauero quo aput nos glacies fit
msItem.explicit: nec enim ulli flumini dulcior gustus
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: Naturales questiones
msItem.note: ed. A. Gercke, Opera 2 (Leipzig, 1907). The text is disordered: the incipit corresponds to 4b.3 (160/11); a major internal division on fol. 14ra to 7.1 (235/5); and the explicit to 4a.2 (157/10). The first three words of the rubric have been added by the same hand of s. xv ex. which supplies them elsewhere, here clarified by an addition (beginning with ‘Aliter’) provided s. xvi/xvii.

msItem.rubric: Dicta sancti IERONIMI de lucio anneo seneca excerpta ex cronica eius quam composuit de uiris illustribus
msItem.incipit: Lvcius annevs senca seneca cordvbensis fotini stoici discipulus et patruus lucani
msItem.explicit: coronarentur martirio a nerone interfectus est
msItem.author: JEROME
msItem.title: De uiris illustribus

msItem.incipit: Credo tibi paule nunciatum quod heri de te [later] cum lucilio nostro
msItem.explicit: istinc properantem Vale sentiaeca hec misericordie nobis honores
msItem.note: PS.-SENECA and PS.-PAUL Epistolae ad Paulum Apostolum, et Pauli ad Senecam ed. Claude W. Barlow (1938), rep. PL supp. 1: 673–8. Followed by six verses (Walther, no. 3960), inc. ‘Cura labor meritum sumpti pro munere | Ite alias post ’: HILDEBERT OF LAVARDIN, ‘Epitaphium Senece’, ed. PL 171:1446.

msItem.rubric: SENECE literarum moralium ad Lucilium librum numero 4ti4. epistole
msItem.incipit: Ita fac mi lvcili vendica te tibi et tempvs qvod adhvc
msItem.explicit: oculos michi effodiunt si pithagore credo [the original explicit, extended by multiple corrections to:] nichil scire noluerunt qui ne hoc quidem nobis reliquerunt nihil se scire [marg.]
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: Epistolae ad Lucilium
msItem.note: Breaking off at the end of book 13; ed. Friedrich Haase, Opera 3 (Leipzig, 1853), 3–254. The rubric is a later guide of s. xiii for a rubricator. The text has been heavily corrected, in the main in the margins. On the history of this text, perhaps thought-provoking with regard to items twice copied below, see Jeannine Fohlen, ‘Comment “fabriquer” un exemplaire complet des Epistolae ad Lucilium’, Scriptorium 49 (1995), 95–106, with a reference to our MS at 97 n. 16.

msItem.incipit: Exigitis rem magis iocundam michi qvam facilem iubetis enim quid
msItem.explicit: bono exemplo dampnatus est proditor malo inuentvs
msItem.author: SENECA THE ELDER
msItem.title: Controversiae
msItem.note: ed. Lennart Håkanson (Leipzig: Teubner, 1989), 1–330 (excerpted). The rubric we cite above is a later guide to a rubricator; the contents table for the MS calls the text ‘De Rethorica alias de causis’. In the lower margin, fol. 119ra, a hand of s. xiii/xiv notes: ‘Iste liber incipit in volumine nostro folio 145.’

msItem.incipit: Inter mvltos ac varios errores temere inconsulteque uiuentium nichil propemodum
msItem.explicit: Non est magni animi perdere et dare
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber viii. annei SENECE de beneficiis
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: De beneficiis
msItem.note: Ed. Karl Hosius, Opera 1.2 (Leipzig: Teubner, 1914), 1–209. A note on fol. 145rb in the same hand as fol. 119: ‘et hic inferius folio 165. sed minus plenarie’.

msItem.incipit: Incipit eiusdem de clementia ad Neronem Sribere Scribere de clementia nero cesar tibi institui ut quodam modo speculi uice
msItem.explicit: Quo modo in rectum parua flectantur
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: De clementia
msItem.note: ed. Hosius, 210–51. Again a note, as in the two previous items: ‘Idem libellus hic inferius folio 172. set alia habetur litera’.

msItem.incipit: Honesta inquit epicurus res est leta paupertas Illa uero non iam
msItem.author: PS.-MARTIN OF BRAGA
msItem.title: De paupertate
msItem.note: (CPL 1089), a collection of excerpts from SENECA’S Epistulae; ed. Haase, 458–61. The remainder of fol. 163vb (nineteen lines) is blank. As is the case with items 5 and 11–13, the only identification is a rubric supplied s. xv ex. (the same hand as in item 1).

msItem.incipit: Inter multos ac uarios errores temere inconsulteque uiuentium nichil propemodum
msItem.explicit: hoc est magna animi perdere et dare
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: De beneficiis
msItem.note: the second (and abbreviated) version promised at item 6 above, with an answering note here: ‘Iste libellus plenius habetur supra folio 146.’ (fol. 164, upper margin).

msItem.incipit: Scriere Scribere de clementia nero cesar constitui ut quodam modo speculi uice
msItem.explicit: hoc de uiciis dare propositum est
msItem.author: SENECA
msItem.title: De clementia
msItem.note: the second (and abbreviated) version promised at item 7 above. Another note (fol. 171, margin): ‘idem supra folio 161. sed ibi plenius’.

msItem.incipit: Omne peccatum actio uoluntaria est Educatio et disciplina mores facit
msItem.author: PS.-SENECA/PS.-MARTIN OF BRAGA
msItem.title: De moribus

msItem.rubric: amor genere ad ealionem de Remediis fortuitorum
msItem.incipit: Licet cunctorum poetarum carmina ingeniium nostrum semper ilustrent aliquando deliberans
msItem.explicit: Vides autem quam domi sit ista felicitas
msItem.author: PS.-SENECA/PS.-MARTIN OF BRAGA
msItem.title: De remediis fortuitorum

msItem.incipit: Qvatuor uirtutum species multorum sapientium sentenciis diffinite sunt Quibus humanus animus
msItem.explicit: principia autem ruentem compos ipse deuitet insaniam aut deficientem puni at ignauiam
msItem.note: In fact MARTIN OF BRAGA, Formula uitae honestae (CPL 1080), without the prologue, ed. Claude W. Barlow, Martini episcopi Bracarensis opera omnia (New Haven, 1950), 237–50.

msItem.title: a contents table
msItem.note: (s. xv); glued to the page is a bit of vellum with the inscription ‘Seneca’ (s. xvii), probably from an earlier binding.

msItem.incipit: Nulle sunt nociuiores insidie quam hee que latent in simulacione officii
msItem.author: HILDEBERT OF LAVARDIN
msItem.title: Septem sapientum sententiae
msItem.note: (Walther, no. 15065), ed. PL 171:1410. In mixed textura/anglicana, s. xiii2 in the lower margin. The verses (fol. 70vab) begin: ‘Senias pireneus Que nam summa bona mens semper concia recti | Pernicies hominis que maxima '

supportDesc.foliation: A medieval foliation in the leading edge lower corner of rectos: it omits fol. 8, and is one ahead of the actual foliation until fol. 176, which is numbered 179.
supportDesc.collation: 1–228. No catchwords; fragmentary signs of leaf signatures now cut away. Signed on the last leaves of quires in roman numerals, in brown crayon and pencil (lacking at fols. 56v, 144v, 168v); in this system, quires 1–20 = i–xx.

layoutDesc.layout:
In double columns, each column
223 74 with 10 mm between columns, in 36–38 lines to the column. Occasional prickings; bounded and ruled in black and brown ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura quadrata, above top line; in spite of extreme variations in duct, arguably a single hand (see fol. 159 for several script-forms in close collision). Punctuation by point and punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blanks for rubrics usually unfilled (some instructions vertically in the margins, and many later identifications).
At text openings 7-line red and blue lombards on red and blue flourishing; at internal divisions, 2- and 3- line alternating red and blue lombards on flourishing of the other colour.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf, two modern paper flyleaves, and a medieval vellum one (fol. iv, preceded by a stub, which is probably its conjugate); at the rear, two modern paper flyleaves and another marbled paper leaf (fols. v–vii).

history.provenance: ‘Per memoriam labiorum meus trenis obligata carcibus carceribus xlxx xiij di c iij ch ’ (fol. 1, upper margin; s. xv, apparently a reference to Gratian).

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002) (with a correction of a typographical error in item 5)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

Eligius Dekkers and Aemilius Gaar, Clavis patrum latinorum, 3rd edn. (Turnhout, 1995).
Jeannine Fohlen, ‘Comment “fabriquer” un exemplaire complet des Epistolae ad Lucilium’, Scriptorium 49 (1995), 95–106.
A. Gercke (ed.), L. Annaei Senecae Opera quae supersunt, 2 (Leipzig, 1907).
Friedrich Haase (ed.), L. Annaei Senecae opera quae supersunt, 3 (Leipzig, 1853).
Lennart Håkanson (ed.) L. Annaeus Seneca Maior. Oratorum et rhetorum sententiae, divisiones, colores (Leipzig: Teubner, 1989).
Karl Hosius (ed.), L. Annaei Senecae Opera quae supersunt, 1.2 (Leipzig: Teubner, 1914).
Hans Walther, Initia carminum ac versuum Medii Aevi posterioris Latinorum, 2nd edn (Göttingen, 1969).
